DOC.brief_summary: This study is designed to determine if either short night time sleep or poor night time sleep could be a risk factor for increasing the rate at which kidney function deteriorates in persons with mild to moderate kidney disease.
DOC.brief_title: Sleep Disturbances as a Risk Factor in Chronic Kidney Disease
DOC.criteria: Mild to Moderate CKD Healthy controls age and gender matched to CKD subjects Regular bedtimes of at least 6h/night, sedentary lifestyle Diabetes Current or previous dialysis for more than 1 month Uncontrolled hypertension Heart failure Liver disease HIV Hemoglobin < 10.5 g/dl Treatment with EProcrit, Epogen, or Aranesp Bone or organ transplant, Use of immunosuppressive drugs within past 6 months Current oral contraceptive use Current pregnancy Chemotherapy for malignancy within past 2 years
